options.label: B

questions.correct_answer: B. Gonioscopy with direct gonioscopes should be done

questions.text: A 22 year old obese woman was brought to emergency with complains of headache since last few weeks. She also gives history of blurring vision in both eyes. She has Polycystic ovarian disease and acne and was taking Metformin and Vitamin A. Fundus examination showed bilateral optic disc swelling. Imaging of brain was normal. Visual fields showed central scotomas. What can be the condition?

questions.text: In which of the following lesions, pupil reactions to light are normal

A 46-year-old man presents to a physician with acute onset of painless, profuse watery diarrhea that appears white and cloudy. The patient denies bloody stool, vomiting, or subjective fevers. Vital signs are T 98.6, HR 120, RR 17, and BP 85/50. On physical exam, the patient has dry mouth, decreased skin turgor, and cold clammy skin. His peripheral pulse is rapid and thready. The toxin responsible for this clinical presentation has a mechanism of action that is most similar to which other toxin?

A 60-year-old woman undergoes a lung transplant due to emphysema secondary to alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency. Following the transplant, she develops a low-grade fever, dyspnea, and non-productive cough. A chest radiograph demonstrates diffuse ground-glass opacities. A biopsy taken during a bronchoscopy of the lung is shown in the image. Choose the correct etiological agent

A 43-year-old male visits the emergency room around 4 weeks after getting bitten by a bat during a cave diving trip in USA. After cleansing the wound with water, the patient reports that he felt well enough not to seek medical attention immediately following his trip. He does endorse feeling feverish in the past week, but a new onset of photophobia and irritability led him to seek help today. After two days later, the patient succumbs. Postmortem brain biopsy shown in the image. Choose the latest vaccine type to prevent this infection?

A 35-year-old shepherd is found to have a large hydatid cyst in his liver. His doctor explains to him that surgery is required to remove the cyst, as aspiration of the contents would risk an anaphylactic reaction in the patient. What is the most likely cause of this patient's cyst?

A 1-day old newborn male infant is evaluated in the hospital after vaginal delivery. During his mother’s third trimester of pregnancy, screening tests revealed positive titers of antibodies that prompted evaluation of congenital infection in her baby following delivery. The infant is evaluated by an ophthalmologist, who identifies the pathologic findings on retinal examination seen in the image. CT scan of the brain shows ring enhancing lesions. On physical examination, the infant is found to have macrocephaly and bulging of the anterior fontanelle. Which of the following congenital infections is the most likely etiology of this patient’s disease?

A 26-year-old female presents to the emergency department with high fever, productive cough, and hemoptysis. She says that she has also been getting red tender bumps under the skin as well as joint pain. She believes that her symptoms started a few days after a small earthquake hit near her hometown and was otherwise healthy prior to these symptoms. No pathogenic bacteria are detected on sputum culture or by Gram stain. Based on clinical suspicion a lung biopsy is performed and the results are shown in the image provided. The most likely pathogen causing this disease lives in which of the following locations?

A 70-year-old male presents with signs and symptoms consistent with community acquired pneumonia. A sputum sample is obtained, and the Gram stain is shown in Figure A. What type of vaccine could have been administered to prevent this patient's illness?

A 26-year-old man presents to his primary care physician with a 3-day history of fever, fatigue, and headache. He says that he recently returned from a hiking vacation. During the trip, he tried to live off the land and acknowledges that his diet included freshly hunted game and mountain stream water. He started experiencing a fever, myalgias, fatigue, and headaches about 2 days after returning from his trip. His past medical history is significant for migraines though he is not currently taking any medications. He has no drug allergies. Physical exam is unremarkable. A blood smear is obtained and stained with the results shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
Bacteria multiplies by transverse binary fission is

A 42-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a rash on her left forearm for 1 day. The rash is erythematous, vesicular, and itchy. The patient denies any fever, joint pain, oral ulcers, or gastrointestinal symptoms. She reports an “allergy” to gluten for 2 years, but has tested negative for celiac disease in the past. Upon further questioning, she revealed that she was volunteering a couple of days ago and was weeding plants in a public yard. What is the most likely explanation of her findings?

In competitive inhibition potency decreases but efficacy remain same D. therapeutic index indicates safety of the drug E. Continuous exposure of a receptor to antagonist results in down regulation of receptor
questions.correct_answer: A. A-F, B-F, C-T, D-T, E-F

Which one of the following statements about the fed and fasting metabolic states is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Fatty acids and triaclyglycerol are in the synthesized in the liver in the fasting state.

options.label: B
options.text: In the fasting state the main fuel for the central nervous system is fatty acids released from adipose tissue.

options.label: C
options.text: In the fasting state the main metabolic fuel for most tissue comes from fatty acids released from adipose tissue.

options.label: D
options.text: In the fed state muscle cannot take up glucose for use as a metabolic fuel because glucose transport in muscle is stimulated in response to glucagon.

questions.correct_answer: C. In the fasting state the main metabolic fuel for most tissue comes from fatty acids released from adipose tissue.

questions.correct_answer: A. An early step in Pyrimidine biosynthesis is the formation of PRPP (phosphoribosyl 1- pyrophosphate).

options.text: Conservative management with NPO and Ryle’s tube.

questions.correct_answer: B. Conservative management with NPO and Ryle’s tube.

A 40-year-old man has had recurrent symptoms suggestive of peptic ulcer disease for 4 years. Endoscopy reveals an ulcer located on the greater curvature of the stomach. A mucosal biopsy reveals Helicobacter pylori. What is false about H. pylori?

options.label: A
options.text: Serology is best follow up test after H Pylori eradication.

options.label: C
options.text: It is associated with chronic gastritis.

options.text: It can be detected by the urea breath test in

questions.correct_answer: A. Serology is best follow up test after H Pylori eradication.

questions.text: A 50-year-old man presents with vague gastric complaints. Findings on physical examination are unremarkable. The serum albumin level is markedly reduced (1.8 g/100 mL). A barium study of the stomach shows massive gastric folds within the proximal stomach. These findings are confirmed by endoscopy. What is the correct diagnosis?
The standard initial therapy for acute sigmoid volvulus is:

options.label: A
options.text: Laparotomy to reduce the volvulus and replace the sigmoid colon to its normal position

questions.text: An 80-year-old woman with a known history of femoral hernia is admitted to the hospital because of strangulation of the hernia. There is a tender swelling in the right femoral region immediately below and lateral to the pubic tubercle. She has had multiple bowel movements without relief of symptoms. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-old-male from Kosovo, who lives alone, presents with diarrhea. On examination he manifests clear wasting and malnutrition. His hematocrit (HCT) is 28%, serum albumin reduced to 2.8 g%, and the blood analysis shows a macrocytic anemia. The emergency department physician is unable to secure an accurate history of the nature of multiple previous operations he had undergone before his arrival in the United States several months previously. What is the likely diagnosis that explains these features?
A 40-year-old woman experiences flushing, diarrhea, and wheezing. On physical examination, she is found to have tricuspid valve insufficiency. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: B. Ileal carcinoid with liver metastasis

questions.text: Following resection of the left colon, a 67- year-old obese woman develops left-sided leg edema due to deep-vein thrombosis. She is placed on anticoagulants, but after 2 weeks of warfarin (Coumadin), she develops a pulmonary embolus with slight hypoxemia. What should the next step in management involve?

options.label: B
options.text: Use of an inferior vena cava (IVC) filter

options.label: C
options.text: CT scan of the leg and abdomen

questions.correct_answer: C. CT scan of the leg and abdomen

questions.text: A 1-week-old infant is brought to the hospital because of vomiting. An upper gastrointestinal (GI) series reveals duodenal obstruction. Laparotomy image in given below. Which of the following statements about this condition is TRUE? ST: Stomach. D: Duodenum

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It is associated with Down’s syndrome.

options.label: C
options.text: Symptoms usually begin with back pain.

options.label: D
options.text: It is most likely due to abnormal rotation encircling the third part of the duodenum

questions.correct_answer: B. It is associated with Down’s syndrome.

questions.text: An elderly male presented with 4 × 5 cm lump in the right neck. FNAC assessment revealed it to be a squamous cell carcinoma. Clinical assessment of oral cavity. Pharynx, hypopharynx and larynx did not reveal any tumour. Whole body PET scan did not show any increased uptake except for the neck mass. A diagnosis of unknown primary was made. questions.correct_answer: B. Pyramidal fracture, with the teeth at the pyramid base, and nasofrontal suture at its apex.

questions.text: A 60-year-old male presents with sudden-onset chest pain and shortness of breath. On examination, he is diaphoretic, tachycardic, and hypotensive. ECG shows changes as shown in the figure. Troponin levels are elevated. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old female with a history of rheumatic fever presents with dyspnea on exertion, orthopnea, and pedal edema. On examination, there's a mid diastolic murmur best heard at the apex. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents with sudden-onset palpitations associated with dizziness and shortness of breath. On examination, her pulse is 180 beats per minute, regular, and there are no other abnormal findings. ECG shows a narrow QRS complex tachycardia without visible P waves. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 42-year-old male with a history of intravenous drug use presents with fever, chills, and a new-onset heart murmur. On examination, there are petechiae on the conjunctiva, splinter hemorrhages, and Osler's nodes on the fingers. Labs reveal elevated inflammatory markers. Echocardiogram shows a vegetation on the aortic valve. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old female presents with fatigue, weakness, and pallor. Laboratory tests reveal microcytic hypochromic red blood cells and low serum ferritin levels. She reports heavy menstrual bleeding. What is the most appropriate initial treatment for this patient's condition?

A 55-year-old female presents with confusion, constipation, and generalized weakness. Laboratory tests show serum calcium levels of 12.5 mg/dL (normal range: 8.5 - 10.5 mg/dL), elevated parathyroid hormone (PTH), and low phosphate levels. Which of the following conditions is most likely causing her hypercalcemia?
A 55-year-old chronic smoker presents with a chronic cough, weight loss, and hemoptysis. Chest X-ray reveals a cavitary lesion in the right upper lobe. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old female presents with acute-onset pleuritic chest pain and dyspnea. On examination, there's decreased breath sounds and dullness to percussion on the left side. Chest X-ray reveals an absent left lung field with mediastinal shift. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old male presents with dyspnea on exertion and a non-productive cough. Pulmonary function tests reveal a reduced diffusing capacity for carbon monoxide (DLCO). Which of the following conditions is most likely to cause this abnormality?

A 50-year-old female presents with jaundice, pruritus, and dark urine. Lab tests show elevated alkaline phosphatase and conjugated bilirubin. Imaging reveals intrahepatic bile duct dilation. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old female presents with right upper quadrant pain, fever, and jaundice. Lab tests show elevated ALP and GGT. Ultrasound reveals gallstones and a dilated common bile duct. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old healthcare worker accidentally sustains a needlestick injury while attending to a patient known to be positive for hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg). The healthcare worker is unvaccinated against hepatitis B. What is the most appropriate immediate management for post-exposure prophylaxis against hepatitis B virus (HBV)?

options.label: C
options.text: Both hepatitis B vaccine and hepatitis B immune globulin (HBIG)

questions.correct_answer: C. Both hepatitis B vaccine and hepatitis B immune globulin (HBIG)

questions.text: A 60-year-old diabetic patient presents with peripheral edema, foamy urine, and elevated serum creatinine. Urinalysis shows proteinuria (>3.5 g/day) without hematuria. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents with abrupt-onset severe headache, nausea, and photophobia. On examination, there's neck stiffness and Kernig's sign positive.There is no fever. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old male presents with progressive memory loss, behavioural changes, and difficulty in performing daily activities. Neurological examination reveals atrophy in the temporal and parietal lobes. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old female presents with heat intolerance, weight loss, palpitations, and tremors. Physical examination show diffusely enlarged non-tender thyroid gland with a bruit. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 40-year-old male presents with central obesity, moon face, buffalo hump, thinning of skin, and easy bruising. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 60-year-old male with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) presents with increased dyspnea and confusion. Arterial blood gas analysis shows pH 7.28, pCO2 60 mmHg, HCO3 30 mEq/L. What acid-base disorder is present, and what is the likely compensatory mechanism?
questions.correct_answer: A. Respiratory acidosis with metabolic compensation

questions.text: A 50-year-old female presents to the emergency department with nausea, vomiting, and confusion. Laboratory analysis reveals serum sodium levels of 125 mEq/L (normal range: 135-145 mEq/L). The patient's medical history includes heart failure, for which she is on treatment with furosemide and lisinopril. A 25-year-old male presents with a high-grade fever, abdominal pain, and diarrhea of one-week duration. Physical examination reveals relative bradycardia and abdominal tenderness. Laboratory investigations show a Widal test demonstrating elevated titers of anti-O (O antigen) and anti-H (H antigen) antibodies. A pregnant lady delivered her 1st child in a hospital; but the child developed neonatal sepsis after discharge and is admitted in hospital back. Under which program the child will receive free services?
“Ayushmann Arogya Mandir” are the renamed version of:
To deliver message on usage of clean waSter supply at home; the best unit for addressing the health message would be?
Minimum level where the Community health officer (CHO) is posted at the:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Community Health Officer (CHO):
  • • • Deputed at HWC – SC
  • • • Roles and Responsibilities:
  • • • Clinical care
  • • • Coordinate tele- health (eSanjeevani)
  • • • Coordinate with MPW M and MPW F
  • • • Coordinate with community platforms like VHNSC; MAS; SHG
  • • • VHNSC: Village Health Nutrition and Sanitation Campaign
  • • • MAS: Mahila Arogya Samiti
  • • • SHG: Self Help Groups
  • • • Chronic disease screening

options.label: C
options.text: Tropical Diseases Targeted for Research and Training

questions.correct_answer: C. Tropical Diseases Targeted for Research and Training

Which of the following is not a germ cell tumor arising from Germ cell Neoplasia in situ (GCNIS)?

options.label: A
options.text: A 4-year old boy with testicular teratoma

options.label: B
options.text: A 38-year old male having a testicular Seminoma

options.label: C
options.text: A 25-year young man having an embryonal carcinoma

options.label: D
options.text: A 22-year college student having a yolk sac tumor

questions.correct_answer: A. A 4-year old boy with testicular teratoma

questions.text: A 44-year-old man in acute distress is havingmultiple ecchymoses of the skin that have developed over the past 48 hours. His PT is 38 seconds and APTT 55 seconds. A CBC shows a WBC count of 5300/microliter, hemoglobin 8.1 g/dL, hematocrit 24.9%, MCV 99 fL, and platelet count 16,300/microliter. Which of the following tests holds significance in diagnosing this man’s condition?
Side scatter in a flow cytometry depicts which of the following?
The following instrument is used for.

SPINK 1 mutation are associated with?
Type I diabetes mellitus is which type of hypersensitivity?

options.label: D
options.text: It is a lifestyle disease not hypersensitivity

Which of the following constitutes Luminal B type of breast carcinoma? I. ER+PR+ HER2 NEU+, High Ki67 II. ER+PR-, HER 2NEU + III. ER+, PR-, Her 2Neu -, High Ki67 IV. ER+, PR+, Her2Neu – high ki67 V. ER+ PR+ HER2 NEU+ Low Ki67

A construction worker presents with weakness, fatigue, constipation and abdominal pain. His job profile is to chip and remove old paint and lay new paint in buildings. His CBC shows Hb 9, MCH 24, MCV 70, retic count 1.8%. which of the following would be best management of this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Start oral B12, folic acid and Iron

questions.text: A 38-year old female underwent blood transfusion for severe blood loss. Although she did not have any transfusion reaction immediately, a week later she presents with epistaxis, multiple purpura on skin. Platelet count is 20000, PT and APTT are within normal limits. What is the appropriate management in this patient?
Match the following

A patient is admitted in emergency room with history suggestive of perforation peritonitis. Physical examination shows multiple ecchymotic patches in the skin. The intensivist is suspicious of a sepsis complicated by DIC and asks intern to draw the blood for culture, coagulation profile, platelet count, blood grouping and cross matching in further management of this patient, which is the correct order of drawing the tubes for the above mentioned tests?
questions.correct_answer: C. Culture tubes> Blue> Red> Levander

questions.text: A 50-year male presenting with dyspeptic symptoms for last 3 years has been taking omeprazole intermittently. Imaging now shows a diffuse thickening in the wall of the stomach. Biopsy from the mass shows neoplastic cells positive for CD19,CD20,CD22,CD79a and negative for CD5,CD10,CD23. The Ki-67 index is low. Which of the following is not a true statement regarding this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: R CHOP is treatment of choice

options.label: C
options.text: T(11;18) can be seen in such tumours

questions.correct_answer: A. R CHOP is treatment of choice

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman had lower third molar extracted due to dental caries. Then she developed high fever and pain. On examination, tonsil deviated medially and there was swelling in upper one-third of sternocleidomastoid muscle, Most likely diagnosis is:
Identify the structure shown in NCCT of Nose and Paranasal Sinuses ( marked with arrow)

Choose the correct option regarding “late syphilis in the temporal bone “ 1. Cochlear duct hydrops is a very common feature. 2. Hennebert's sign may be positive. 3. Steroids have no effect on hearing deficit. 4. Tullio phenomena may be a symptom.

A 9-month-old boy was admitted to hospital after a 5-day history of stridor, cough, and hoarseness. On examination the suprasternal fossa, supraclavicular fossa, and intercostal space were retractions during inhalation. Inspiratory stridor and moist rales could be heard in the lungs. The cardiac examination result was found to be normal. The family doctor diagnosed congenital laryngomalacia and ordered vitamin D and calcium supplements. The symptoms improved but never completely disappeared. Because of considering congenital diseases or space-occupying diseases of throat, neck CT examination was done, which indicated linear diaphragm in glottis (Fig A). Laryngoscopy revealed that the glottis was covered by webbed connection, which blocked nearly two thirds of glottis, Choose the most appropriate statement.

options.label: A
options.text: Usually involves the posterior one sixth of the vocal cords.

options.label: B
options.text: Surgical intervention required in two third of the patients.

options.label: C
options.text: Excision should be performed as early as possible.

options.label: D
options.text: The atresia may be a cause of still birth.

questions.correct_answer: D. The atresia may be a cause of still birth.

questions.text: 65 yrs old male complaining of epistaxis, nasal obstruction since last 3 yrs, On examination soft tissue mass seen in middle meatus on further radiological investigations reveals mass originating from maxillary sinus extending into pterygoid fossa and ethmoidal sinus,comment on the “T” status of the patient:
A patient with unilateral SSCD undergoes successful middle cranial fossa repair. Preoperatively, his SP : AP ratio was 0.70. After surgery, his SP : AP ratio should be which of the following?

options.label: D
options.text: The ratio should remain the same.

questions.text: Dry atrophic nasal mucosa, extensive encrustations with ‘woody’ hard external nose and crust formation as shown in the image ; is suggestive of:
In contrast to an intact canal-wall mastoidectomy, the canal-wall-down procedure requires:

options.label: A
options.text: Meticulous identification of the fallopian canal

options.label: C
options.text: Saucerization of the margins of the mastoidectomy

options.label: D
options.text: Thinning of the bone of the tegmen mastoideum

questions.correct_answer: C. Saucerization of the margins of the mastoidectomy

questions.text: Which of the following statements best describes the management of recurrent respi- ratory papillomatosis (RRP)?

options.label: A
options.text: Complete eradication of disease is essential.

options.label: B
options.text: The goal of surgical therapy is to maintain a patent airway, improve voice quality, and avoid harm.

options.label: C
options.text: Adjuvant therapies such as cidofovir should be used in children with mild RRP that require surgical intervention two times or fewer per year.

options.label: D
options.text: Tracheostomy is a mainstay of treatment and should be considered in all infants diag- nosed with RRP.

questions.correct_answer: B. The goal of surgical therapy is to maintain a patent airway, improve voice quality, and avoid harm.

questions.text: Most common laryngeal findings of laryngomalacia includes all except :

options.label: A
options.text: Inward collapse of A–E folds and cuneiform cartilage

questions.text: While examining a patient with a right forearm fracture, you P ask him to male a fist. The following finding is notes during this procedure. What is the sign called as?
De Quervain tenosynovitis ?

options.label: A
options.text: Abductor pollicis longus and extensor pollicis longus

options.label: B
options.text: Abductor pollicis longus and extensor pollicis brevis

options.label: C
options.text: Abductor pollicis brevis and extensor pollicis longus

options.label: D
options.text: Abductor pollicis brevis and extensor pollicis brevis

questions.correct_answer: B. Abductor pollicis longus and extensor pollicis brevis
